review.description:
Alright, alright; so once again, after exactly two months, my OCD got the better of me. 

Asya offers the sloppy pav only for lunch, only on weekdays, and only for delivery (no sloppy pav for dine-in customers). This limits the enjoyment of this piece of divinity to those who work near downtown Brooklyn... and to the likes of me! Once again, I procured a hotel room in Brooklyn Heights, worked remotely from Brooklyn on a Friday, and ordered three beef sloppy pavs for delivery. 

The sloppy pav is an Indian take on sloppy joe sliders. The mini buns are stuffed with tender and moist short rib that is braised with spices and black cardamom, which makes it flavorful and aromatic. It comes with masala chips and a side of jalapeno aioli. I requested the restaurant not to put lettuce and tomato on my pavs (those "veggies" just don't belong in a sloppy pav). I also requested an extra side of the jalapeno aioli, which I added to my already moist and tasty sloppy pav; and that, my friends, took it to yet another level of deliciousness! 

If you work near downtown Brooklyn, or just happen to be in the area during the day on a weekday, I would highly recommend trying this delectable treat. If you don't like it, you're just not worthy of my acquaintance!
review.author: Kashif K.

review.description:
Went here with a friend and left a $4 tip on a $20 bill, which is a 20% tip.

A woman (who wasn't our waiter) insulted us and yelled "Your tip is no good!"

She was mad because their lunch special was a 25% discount, so she wanted us to tip on the undiscounted price of $25, rather than the discounted price of $20.

We threw the extra dollar onto the table and left without a word since we'll never come back.

A other reviewers have noted, the food quality has dropped off, so no big loss.  It's not like there aren't billions of other Indian restaurants in NYC.
review.author: Peter S.

review.description:
Okay. So I have PTSD which makes remembering events and other information extremely difficult  sometimes. I didn't remember eating here before, but when I read my review, I thought, it must have been good for me to give 5 stars. 

It seems unfortunately that a lesson must be taught on how to communicate with customers and provide the best service possible. 

I had an old Restaurant.com voucher for this place. I showed it to the person at the storefront from my iPad. She told me the restaurant doesn't honor it anymore. I said, "then you should tell Restaurant.com so they can remove the offer." She said, "Come back tomorrow when the owner is here." Come back tomorrow?! Seriously? That is what you tell vendors, not potential customers. 

I decided to eat there anyway, again having no memory of eating there before. I sat down and asked for a menu. I will skip the details of what happens next. In short, the hostess/waitress treated me like I was a tourist who doesn't tip. (Sorry European tourists; the bias is true.) After time passed and different staff went by, I got up and left. 

Maybe I will return when one of the owners is there. But if that lady is the only one on the floor, forget it.
review.author: Kiai K.

review.description: Excellent curry and seafood. The people are extremely nice and a very cozy place. The owners are always smiling :) the bread was great and the rice was delightful.
review.author: Manuel P.

review.description:
I got delivery from this place with my coworkers using Seamless. Took two hours because the guy didn't want to deliver in the rain (called to confirm this which also took several tries to get an explanation).

So, if you guessed that my food was lukewarm to cold, you guessed right! My Lamb Biryani was cold and heavily dosed in what believe is curry, what could be better than that? This also costed me $19 which is ridiculous and way overpriced after tips for the service we got.

Recommendation? Find another place.
review.author: Jacky C.

review.description:
Went to the location for takeout, which seemed to be a huge inconvenience to the woman there. To get out of her way, we took a seat while we waited. For 40 minutes. (We were told 15-20.) The woman barely acknowledged us as we waited even longer to pay. After all this, we were hoping the food would be good.

The Malai Kofta was decent but nothing special, especially for the price. The "Mixed Grill" (An Assortment of Lamb, Chicken and Seafood) was barely enough food and the meat was very dry.
review.author: Cassie W.

review.description: Ordered some lunch to go.  I'd give it a single star, but the food was not too bad (not great, but not too bad). Problem was the customer experience overall.  If you have a giant sign outside your business advertising lunch special, don't wait until you give a guy the bill that the specials are only for dine-in customers.  This policy doesn't make any sense any way.  Its not like there was a lot more food here.   We didn't  need any attention from the staff beyond taking the to go order  . But policy is policy, OK.  Still the person in staff was far from polite or helpful about the issue.  Not going back.
review.author: Peter A.

review.description: I'm not sure why these reviews are so low. I love asya and think it's the best Indian food around. The Kati rolls and all the curries are amazing. The owner is really nice and so are all the staff. Really underrated.
review.author: Cydney E.

review.description:
horrible experience,...extremely, extremely rude, standoffish and poor service for sub-par food. ruined my afternoon. no wonder no one goes here!

I went in one day and the food was decent and lunch special prices were great....went in the very next day, got the same thing and was told that they don't take cards after I finished the meal. BTW i had used a card just the day before. I mentioned that and the waitress proceeded to call me a liar, claiming they have a strict cash only policy (seriously what century is this?), threatening to overcharge my card, threatening to pull out security camera footage just to see whether I really used my card the day before, asking me to leave my stuff and go to a nearby ATM and finally, after i lost my patience, accepting payment by card, which didn't seem to inconvenience them much. 

Oh and the food went from decent to horrible too. And did I mention that the waitress was standoffish while i was ordering the food as well and only reluctantly argued to cater to my specifications after lecturing me about indian food. And I am Indian, born and raised!!
extremely extremely poor service! Right before leaving, I told her that her behavior is exactly how you lose a customer, a guy who had come 2 days in a row. 

i live in the area and no wonder they are always emptier than a cemetery each time I pass by.!
review.author: Itihaas S.

review.description:
Terrible customer service... Very rude over the phone. I found them on Google maps and looked through their menu there (which had no prices!), didn't see wether they would do a delivery anywhere so decided to call. A woman answered and upon being asked if they deliver, she answered something rapidly and incoherently about their hours of operation, so thing about them not being open yet, I guess. That didn't make any sense as I was calling at 4pm on a Saturday... I asked again if they delivered and I heard one sharp short No!
I thanked and got off the phone to continue looking for an Indian spot on Uber Eats and Seamless... I found that restaurant on both and YES! They do deliver. 
I will never attempt to order from them again and I suggest you don't either. There's a lot of very good Indian restaurants in vicinity ran by very sweet people. Choose them instead.
review.author: Sara F.

review.description:
Excellent North Indian food :) The Naans were too good.
The best part was 50% discount on whole lunch menu.
Not sure if the person who received us inside was the owner, but he can put up a little smile while welcoming. His stern look will not be of any help to the restaurant.
The person who served us was very friendly and also asked for feedback about the food then and there.
review.author: Vivek D.

review.description:
Asya was a restaurant I would regularly visit. However, the last time I was there I asked for Vindaloo and was given a bad rendition of Tikka instead. When I walked all the way back (sick and in the heat) after being told it would be replaced, the waitress/owner insisted it was Vindaloo. Having lived in India for 18 years, I knew the difference. I also knew I had been scammed. It was a waste of 20 dollars and I will never eat there again. They have gained one serving of Vindaloo and lost a regular customer. 

PS: There are tons of Indian restaurants in the area. I suggest you visit those for a much better experience. 

PPS: The two men who serve are very kind and helpful. This is not directed towards them
review.author: Aishwarya S.

review.description: The food was delicious but needed a little more spice. Love the decor. Service leaves a little bit to be desired. We had the Chicken Tikka Masala and ordered shrimp Tikka Masala which was not on the menu, but they were willing to make it. The rice portion was perfect. The Naan bread was warm, just out the oven. The prices were reasonable.
review.author: Julissa E.

review.description:
Good food but terrible service.

Pros:

The food. My wife ordered the tikka masala, and I got a similar tasting appetizer for myself. We both had a side of garlic naan bread as well. All of it was great! The chicken was flavorful, and the naan bread was an awesome complement.

Cons:

Everything about the waiting staff and the service they provided was terrible. We arrived half an hour before they were closing for a short break, and ordered knowing they had food 50% off for lunch. We ate our food quickly, mainly because two of the waiting staff were clearly glaring at us from the counter the entire meal (which lasted maybe 15 minutes). Plates were immediately taken if any of us took a break from eating, and the check was forced upon us shortly thereafter. Before we left, my wife asked for a box for the remainder of her food. They provided her with a small box for the entree, but nothing for the appetizer. When she asked for a box for the naan bread, the waitress rudely told her they "aren't allowed to do that normally, but she would find something." This would be almost understandable if the bread was provided at no charge, but that wasn't the case. After quite obviously slamming plates from our table in the kitchen while I was in the bathroom, the same waitress told my wife to wait go wait outside (in the cold) because they were closing soon. She stayed inside. We gave them a fittingly low tip and walked out the door. 

The only reason I'm giving this restaurant 2 stars instead of 1 is because admittedly, the food was good. But everything else was a negative experience we won't soon forget.

TL;DR - Rushed service, extremely rude waiting staff. But good food.
review.author: Tyler M.

review.description:
Come here at night or when the sun is setting and the interior  brightens up. It's lovely.

The service is ok. Our waiter was a midle aged man, thr type who doesn't say much, just takes your order and appears like once again. There was a woman filling up our drinks constantly. She did a better job being attentive.

The prices of the food were reasonable and the flavor was great. Appetizer we got was chicken Tikka. The chicken was so moist you put a fork in it and it'd break apart. Then we got Behl Per? It was served cold and it had 2 flavors, one that tasted liked a light bbq sauce and another like a cilantro spicy lime sauce mixed with veggies and chutney.

Entree I had a Korma. The texture of the sauce was a light slightly dense buttery melt in your mouth almond sauce and the chicken moist as well.

Don't be fooled by the small bowls. The food is filling!

Only thing I didn't like was that when they asked us what type of Naan we wanted. I thought it was complimentary since they asked us but they charged $4....

Definitely an interesting place to check out, however with mediocre service.
review.author: Samantha Q.

review.description:
I would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could.

The space is charming, comfortable, and authentic. The food is extremely flavorful. And the service is the best I've received in Brooklyn -- Anthony is fantastic.

Highly recommended.
review.author: Jessica L.

review.description:
Food is outstanding. The waiter was rude and wanted us to leave so they could seat more people. So it's defiantly not a place to sit, relax, and visit.

But the ambiance is very inviting and quaint.
review.author: Jonathan S.

review.description: I want to love this place. Ate at the restaurant once, food quite good even if service meh. Ordered takeout, took twice the time indicated and arrived cold. Decided to give it one more shot, ordered well over an hour ago. Called restaurant just to inquire on timing. Was told delivery only just leaving. Very rude response, no apologies, no explanation. In a city and neighborhood with so many options, I want to support small and local, but when they fail to deliver on both product and service, I can't justify spending my money here.
review.author: C M.

review.description:
We went to this place after walking down Brooklyn Bridge. Service was horrendous to say the least. As some other folks have noted the food is decent enough to although the the portion sizes are small. 
Staff was pretty rude and ostentatious to say the least. Refused to provide any recommendations. Old lady was aggressive and pretty rude. Sample the following gems from a single visit.. Won't visit ever 

Quips were like 
- Everything is special. You guys have to decide for yourself. 
- Our veg options are very limited. Try what is available. 
- if it's not in menu then it's not available. That's common sense. (To a 8 year old asking for an item) 

Avoid if possible ..
review.author: Supragya D.

review.description:
Unfortunately, I've been here twice and both times I have experienced problems with the service and an incorrectly calculated bill.  They do correct the bill if you point it out, but are not apologetic about it.  Keep a close eye on your bill.

Mediocre food.  For good Indian food, you're much better off going to Queens or the Curry Hill neighborhood in Manhattan.
review.author: J B.
